item.title: The never ending conflict between
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

TabbyKiller:

Just look how far CoD has come. From just Game Modes to Games Modes and Perks to Games Modes, perks and kill streaks to Game Modes, perks, kill streaks and achievements to Game Modes, perks, kill streaks, achievements and contracts. And now customizable weapons…

Which makes up the shit hole it is today!

item.title: The never ending conflict between
item.dc:creator: @durial12 durial12
item.description:
@durial12 wrote:

I think it depends what kind of game you like playing. Some gamers prefer to play more realistic games. They enjoy them a lot more because maybe they understand what is happening and it can relate to something they know in real life. For example, in BattleField 2, you could easily relate this to a war between two sides. (And it is quite a realistic war if you take away respawns.)

Then, on the other hand, you have CoD. Don’t get me wrong I like a game of CoD but for completely different reasons. This game is not realistic and you cannot relate it to anything that really happens in real life. Snipers don’t go around quick scoping. People don’t do 360’s in Iraq. That would be stupid (maybe someone has done it, I don’t know.).

So these games, in theory, could be placed on entirely different platforms. As other people have said; Battlefield is a strategic game that often requires teamwork and this resembles what it would be like in a real war. Modern Warfare is much more of a fast paced FPS, where you are a computer character with a gun, not a marine fighting a war.

Read full topic

item.title: The never ending conflict between
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Battlefield is a more slow-paced strategy game. How often do you see real teamwork in CoD? Bad Company 2 is built around the kit system, and everyone has a role to help their team in any kit. It’s slow-paced because the maps are so large. Perhaps Battlefield 3 will add a few maps that are smaller for faster action. Don’t get me wrong, Battlefield games are still full of action anyway, you just need to know where to go.

Campers are easy to destroy in Bad Company 2 just as easy as they are in CoD. As said above, you have access to so many weapons and tools to destroy campers. Also, unless you’re playing hardcore, the game will also show you where the person was/is going while you respawn.

One thing I am hoping for in BF3 is that they will have more unlocks. I can’t remember what the level is (22 or 23), but after that in BC2 you didn’t unlock anything else. I’m also hoping for more game types.

As I said before, you are comparing two completely different games. In my opinion, MW2 is a broken game that is no longer fun to me except for quickscoping matches. Otherwise CoD 4, Battlefield games, or RDR for me.

Read full topic

item.title: The never ending conflict between
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

While I voted BF, how can you compare different games? The only similar thing is the fact that it’s a first person shooter. Each game was designed entirely different. Call of Duty is based around a quick game, along with an easy to play shooter, while in Battlefield, the games take more time, and it’s not as easy to get a crazy game with like 85 kills, because there is always more to worry about (choppers, snipers, manned turrets, mortar, etc.).
I just don’t think they are comparable, as they are each good and bad in there own reasons. If the poll was you have 2 disks in front of you and you can put one into play, I’d place battlefield in, but I play COD a lot too.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

[quote=“R A R E S, post:5, topic:389895”][quote author=casey. link=topic=485803.msg3559781#msg3559781 date=1302173164]

Battlefield is so slow… campers every corner. Theres no game like cod

Not really, BF is usually bigger maps, more open areas. Cod has way more campers.
[/quote]

Bigger maps = More campers in my opinion. COD keeps it’s maps to more of a medium size and the only real big map there is in MW2 is Wasteland or whatever and there are no buildings so COD ftw :p[/quote]
There isn’t as many campers as there are in cod. In bfbc2, there are so many things to destroy a camper, its pointless. It is also very hard because of the follow cam after your dead.

ziplock:

Battfeild 3 hasn’t even came out yet, so how can you compare gameplay?? As for MW2 VS BF:BC 2, Bad Company 2 blows Modern Warfare 2 out of it’s own asshole. Completely destructible environment, vehicles, extremely large maps but still action around every corner, it’s just amazing in my opinion. Although, I do think Modern warfare was way better than Modern Warfare 2.

+1

Read full topic

Chassy13:

I honestly prefer a battlefield game over a CoD game, but it’s hard to compare the two. They have different styles of game play.

I like to think of COD as a more arcade/cartoon version of Battlefield which simulates a real war rather than an Old School war.

item.title: The never ending conflict between
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Why do people think camping is so bad? If get killed by a camper, don’t you think you would come up with a strategy in getting into his spot instead of bum-rushing your way into a bullet?

Generally, campers are smarter and tend to rack up a better KDR overall.

As far as games in superiority, I’d chose BF due to it’s campaign. Any FPS tends to be crappy online.

The PC gaming community isn’t so bad, because generally most of them aren’t assholes, and most of them have at least half a brain.

However, in terms of the actual games, I’d have to go for BattleField :).
